* * * | | Our Networks spanning all continents will be hosting country-level SDG Pioneers campaigns to identify business leaders who will then be contenders for the global round to be recognized in September 2024.

As part of the UN Global Compact SDG Pioneers programme, [Global Compact Networks](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/engage-locally)
spanning all continents launched a national search for professionals who are committed to achieving the Global Goals.

Interested candidates from companies headquartered in any of the countries listed above must submit their applications through the respective Local Network. 

The winner of each country’s Local Round will receive the title “2024 Global Compact Network \[Country\] SDG Pioneer”.

* * *

The UN Global Compact will recognize 12 Global SDG Pioneers under two award categories: 1) Large National and Multinational companies and 2) SMEs\*.

In addition to this, the UN Global Compact will recognize Global SDG Pioneers under 6 categories representing the regions where we operate: Western Europe and North America, Latin America and Caribbean, Eastern Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia-Oceania.

\*SMEs are considered businesses with 10-250 employees while micro-enterprises would be businesses with 1-9 employees. | | | | --- | | **Eligibility:**

* * * | | To be eligible, applicants must come from UN Global Compact participating companies with an “Active” status.

Companies must have joined the UN Global Compact prior to 1 October 2023.

To maintain Active status, companies must submit their Communication on Progress (CoP) within the reporting time frame of 1 April to 31 July. Subsidiaries can participate if their parent company meets this obligation. To avoid any disruption to your Pioneers application process, companies are strongly encouraged to submit their CoP by 1 June 2024. Failure to report by 31 July will disqualify a Pioneers application. A change in CoP status subsequent to being recognized as a Local and/or Global SDG Pioneer may result in the loss of consideration for the global SDG Pioneer title.

Click here to learn more about our enhanced Communication on Progress: [Learn More](https://unglobalcompact.org/participation/report/cop)

* * *

**Campaign Launch: April 3, 2024**

**Submission Period: April 3, 2024 - May 30, 2024**

**Local SDG Pioneers Announcement: July 1, 2024**

**Global Round Review and Selection: May 17, 2024 - August 2024**

**Announcement of Global Winners and Recognition at the [2024 Leaders Summit](https://unglobalcompact.org/take-action/events/2248-un-global-compact-leaders-summit)
: Date Sep 24, 2024**

* * *

Individuals working at companies participating in the UN Global Compact are invited to submit their own stories describing their contributions towards sustainable development or nominate a colleague for consideration in the SDG Pioneers programme. | | | | | --- | --- | | In September 2015, all 193 Member states of the United Nations adopted a plan for achieving a better future for all – laying out a path over the next 15 years to end extreme poverty, fight inequality and injustice, and protect our planet. At the heart of the “Agenda 2030” are 17 [Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)](http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/sustainable-development-goals/)
 and 169 related targets that address the most important economic, social, environmental and governance challenges of our time. To learn more about how companies are taking steps to contribute to achieving the SDGs visit the UN Global Compact [website](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/our-work/sustainable-development/global-goals-local-business)
. | The Ten Principles of the United Nations Global Compact are derived from:

* [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights)
,
* [International Labour Organization’s Declaration on Fundamental Principles and Rights at Work](http://www.ilo.org/declaration/lang--en/index.htm)
,
* [Rio Declaration on Environment and Development](https://sustainabledevelopment.un.org/rio20/futurewewant)
, and
* [United Nations Convention Against Corruption](http://www.unodc.org/unodc/en/treaties/CAC/index.html)
.

[Click here to learn more:](https://unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/mission/principles) | ### Meet the previous SDG Pioneers [2016](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2016) [2017](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2017) [2018](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2018) [2019](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2019) [2020](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2020) [2021](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2021) [2022](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2022) [2023](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2023) FAQ === ### General Who are the 2024 SDG Pioneers? Each year, the UN Global Compact recognizes a class of SDG Pioneers — business professionals working at any level of their company who use business as a force to advance the 17 SDGs. Through their own company or by mobilizing other businesses, they are helping to reach one or more of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) while also contributing to business success. In 2024, Networks spanning all continents will host country-level SDG Pioneers campaigns to identify Local Pioneers who will then be contenders for the Global Round to be recognized at the 2024 UN Global Compact Leaders Summit. Who is eligible? Professionals working at any level of a UN Global Compact participating company are eligible to apply or be nominated. To check whether an organization is a UN Global Compact participating company, please search the participant list [online](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/participants) . For the 2024 SDG Pioneers, we only consider companies who were participants of the UN Global Compact on October 1, 2023 and have submitted their 2024 Communication on Progress (CoP) within the reporting time frame of 1 April to 31 July. The UN Global Compact reserves the right to remove the SDG Pioneer recognition if the company and/or individual is later deemed a reputational risk to the SDG Pioneer campaign and/or the UN Global Compact initiative. What if I am affiliated with but not directly employed by a UN Global Compact signatory? You are only eligible to apply or be nominated if employed by the company (or its subsidiary). My company does not yet participate in the UN Global Compact. Can I still apply? Only individuals from UN Global Compact participating companies are eligible to apply or be nominated. If your company is not yet participating in the UN Global Compact, please visit the UN Global Compact [website](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/participation/join/application) website to learn more about how to join. Who can submit a nomination? You can nominate a colleague at your company or someone you know from another UN Global Compact participating company. The UN Global Compact will then contact that individual and invite them to complete the SDG Pioneers application form. How do I apply myself or nominate someone I think is doing great work? Please complete the online application form, which is available [here](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/nominate-yourself/new) . To nominate someone, click [here](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/nomination-form/new) here. My organization is doing great work. Can it be nominated? No, the SDG Pioneers campaign highlights the work of individuals, not organizations. What is the nomination deadline? The nomination deadline is **May 17, 2024**. ### Selection Process How will the SDG Pioneers be selected? A multi-stakeholder SDG Pioneers Selection Group will vote on the candidates. The SDG Pioneers Selection Group will comprise representatives from: Global Compact Network Board Members, UN, Government Representatives, Academia, and civil society. How and when will I be notified if I am selected? The Local SDG Pioneer will be informed of his/her selection before July 1st, 2024. This individual will then advance to the Global Round to compete. 2024 Global SDG Pioneers will be selected and recognized at the UN Global Compact Leaders Summit in September 2024. Due to the volume of nominations received, we may be unable to contact nominees who are not selected. ### Recognition How will the Local SDG Pioneers be recognized? What will I receive if selected? Local Networks will recognize Local Pioneers for the great work that they have done to advance the Sustainable Development Goals. 2024 Global SDG Pioneers will be recognized at the UN Global Compact Leaders Summit in September 2024. I have more questions. Who can I contact? Please email [sdgpioneers@unglobalcompact.org](mailto:sdgpioneers@unglobalcompact.org) with any additional questions. SDG Pioneers ================= Peer Learning Groups Each year, we celebrate the remarkable efforts of business professionals who are driving positive change by advancing the 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and embodying the Ten Principles of the UN Global Compact. These individuals, known as SDG Pioneers, play a crucial role in inspiring action and showcasing the power of business to create a sustainable future for all. In 2024, we are thrilled to embark on another journey to identify twelve SDG Pioneers from participating companies. These pioneers, regardless of their role, are setting ambitious SDG targets, expanding their impact, and championing a principles-based approach within their companies. Through a rigorous selection process comprising both Local and Global Rounds, we will recognize individuals who exemplify dedication, innovation, and leadership in advancing the SDGs.  Join us in celebrating these champions of sustainability and learn how you can be part of the movement towards a more inclusive, equitable, and sustainable world. | | | | --- | --- | | **Apply Now:**

* * * | | Our Networks spanning all continents will be hosting country-level SDG Pioneers campaigns to identify business leaders who will then be contenders for the global round to be recognized in September 2024.

As part of the UN Global Compact SDG Pioneers programme, [Global Compact Networks](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/engage-locally)
spanning all continents launched a national search for professionals who are committed to achieving the Global Goals.

Interested candidates from companies headquartered in any of the countries listed above must submit their applications through the respective Local Network. 

The winner of each country’s Local Round will receive the title “2024 Global Compact Network \[Country\] SDG Pioneer”.

* * *

The UN Global Compact will recognize 12 Global SDG Pioneers under two award categories: 1) Large National and Multinational companies and 2) SMEs\*.

In addition to this, the UN Global Compact will recognize Global SDG Pioneers under 6 categories representing the regions where we operate: Western Europe and North America, Latin America and Caribbean, Eastern Europe, Middle East, Africa and Asia-Oceania.

\*SMEs are considered businesses with 10-250 employees while micro-enterprises would be businesses with 1-9 employees. | | | | --- | | **Eligibility:**

* * * | | To be eligible, applicants must come from UN Global Compact participating companies with an “Active” status.

Companies must have joined the UN Global Compact prior to 1 October 2023.

To maintain Active status, companies must submit their Communication on Progress (CoP) within the reporting time frame of 1 April to 31 July. Subsidiaries can participate if their parent company meets this obligation. To avoid any disruption to your Pioneers application process, companies are strongly encouraged to submit their CoP by 1 June 2024. Failure to report by 31 July will disqualify a Pioneers application. A change in CoP status subsequent to being recognized as a Local and/or Global SDG Pioneer may result in the loss of consideration for the global SDG Pioneer title.

Click here to learn more about our enhanced Communication on Progress: [Learn More](https://unglobalcompact.org/participation/report/cop)

At the heart of the “Agenda 2030” are 17 [Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs)](http://www.un.org/sustainabledevelopment/sustainable-development-goals/)
 and 169 related targets that address the most important economic, social, environmental and governance challenges of our time. To learn more about how companies are taking steps to contribute to achieving the SDGs visit the UN Global Compact [website](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/our-work/sustainable-development/global-goals-local-business)

* [Universal Declaration of Human Rights](https://www.un.org/en/about-us/universal-declaration-of-human-rights)
,

[Click here to learn more:](https://unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/mission/principles) | ### Meet the previous SDG Pioneers [2016](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2016) [2017](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2017) [2018](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2018) [2019](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2019) [2020](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2020) [2021](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2021) [2022](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2022) [2023](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/2023) FAQ === ### General Who are the 2024 SDG Pioneers? Each year, the UN Global Compact recognizes a class of SDG Pioneers — business professionals working at any level of their company who use business as a force to advance the 17 SDGs. Through their own company or by mobilizing other businesses, they are helping to reach one or more of the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) while also contributing to business success. In 2024, Networks spanning all continents will host country-level SDG Pioneers campaigns to identify Local Pioneers who will then be contenders for the Global Round to be recognized at the 2024 UN Global Compact Leaders Summit. Who is eligible? Professionals working at any level of a UN Global Compact participating company are eligible to apply or be nominated. To check whether an organization is a UN Global Compact participating company, please search the participant list [online](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/what-is-gc/participants) . For the 2024 SDG Pioneers, we only consider companies who were participants of the UN Global Compact on October 1, 2023 and have submitted their 2024 Communication on Progress (CoP) within the reporting time frame of 1 April to 31 July. The UN Global Compact reserves the right to remove the SDG Pioneer recognition if the company and/or individual is later deemed a reputational risk to the SDG Pioneer campaign and/or the UN Global Compact initiative. What if I am affiliated with but not directly employed by a UN Global Compact signatory? You are only eligible to apply or be nominated if employed by the company (or its subsidiary). My company does not yet participate in the UN Global Compact. Can I still apply? Only individuals from UN Global Compact participating companies are eligible to apply or be nominated. If your company is not yet participating in the UN Global Compact, please visit the UN Global Compact [website](https://www.unglobalcompact.org/participation/join/application) website to learn more about how to join. Who can submit a nomination? You can nominate a colleague at your company or someone you know from another UN Global Compact participating company. The UN Global Compact will then contact that individual and invite them to complete the SDG Pioneers application form. How do I apply myself or nominate someone I think is doing great work? Please complete the online application form, which is available [here](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/nominate-yourself/new) . To nominate someone, click [here](https://unglobalcompact.org/sdgs/sdgpioneers/nomination-form/new) here. My organization is doing great work. Can it be nominated? No, the SDG Pioneers campaign highlights the work of individuals, not organizations. What is the nomination deadline? The nomination deadline is **May 17, 2024**. ### Selection Process How will the SDG Pioneers be selected? A multi-stakeholder SDG Pioneers Selection Group will vote on the candidates. The SDG Pioneers Selection Group will comprise representatives from: Global Compact Network Board Members, UN, Government Representatives, Academia, and civil society. How and when will I be notified if I am selected? The Local SDG Pioneer will be informed of his/her selection before July 1st, 2024. This individual will then advance to the Global Round to compete. 2024 Global SDG Pioneers will be selected and recognized at the UN Global Compact Leaders Summit in September 2024. Due to the volume of nominations received, we may be unable to contact nominees who are not selected. ### Recognition How will the Local SDG Pioneers be recognized? What will I receive if selected? Local Networks will recognize Local Pioneers for the great work that they have done to advance the Sustainable Development Goals. 2024 Global SDG Pioneers will be recognized at the UN Global Compact Leaders Summit in September 2024. I have more questions. Who can I contact? Please email [sdgpioneers@unglobalcompact.org](mailto:sdgpioneers@unglobalcompact.org) with any additional questions. In this section [What is the UN Global Compact](/what-is-gc) ============================================= * [Our Mission](/what-is-gc/mission) * [The Ten Principles](/what-is-gc/mission/principles) * [Our Impact](/what-is-gc/mission/our-impact) * [Our Work](/what-is-gc/our-work) * [Our Participants](/what-is-gc/participants) * [UN Global Compact Strategy](/what-is-gc/strategy) Our Ambition ============ Our Ambition is to: Accelerate and scale the global collective impact of business by upholding the Ten Principles and delivering the SDGs through accountable companies and ecosystems that enable change. To make this happen, the UN Global Compact supports companies to: 1. Do business responsibly by aligning their strategies and operations with [Ten Principles](/what-is-gc/mission/principles) on human rights, labour, environment and anti-corruption; and 2. Take strategic actions to advance [broader societal goals](/what-is-gc/our-work/sustainable-development) , such as the [UN Sustainable Development Goals](/what-is-gc/our-work/sustainable-development/sdgs) , with an emphasis on collaboration and innovation. [View the Ten Principles](/what-is-gc/mission/principles) [![Why business must be a force for good](https://d306pr3pise04h.cloudfront.net/uploads/de/de19e6468fccb3b93e084da8208f754f8992c77a---GC15-brandvideo_graphic.jpg)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gCfMFppotJg&feature=youtu.be) Inspiring, guiding and catalyzing change ======================================== We provide a principle-based framework, best practices, resources and networking events that have revolutionized how companies do business responsibly and keep commitments to society. By catalyzing action, partnerships and collaboration, we make transforming the world possible – and achievable – for organizations large and small, anywhere around the globe. [Our Strategy](/what-is-gc/strategy) Accelerating Global Collective Impact ===================================== We’re proud of the success stories we’ve helped establish. UN Global Compact participants across industries are changing the way they operate to implement responsible practices and developing innovative solutions to address poverty and inequality, and support education, health and peace, to name just a few areas.
